Displays the main market area for users to view and purchase NFTs representing clean-up efforts.
Displays key metrics of the project's impact: total
Allows users to sort and view NFTs that are currently the most popular or highly traded.
Allows users to sort and view the most
Allows users to sort and view NFTs based on a metric
value, highest impact, or highest sale volume.
Clicking on any NFT card opens a dedicated page/modal to view its full details, including
Accesses the Marketplace screen (the current screen).
Allows users to access a screen for capturing or logging clean-up data (likely for Helpers).
Allows users to access a screen related to fishers or specific clean-up participants.
Allows users to access a screen for data aggregation or other specific tool/functionality.
Displays a central area for the camera feed, allowing users to frame the plastic they are collecting.
Activates the camera to capture a new image of the collected plastic.
Allows the user to select and upload an existing photo of collected plastic from their device's media gallery.
Accesses the data capture screen (the current "Collect Plastic" screen).
Allows users to access a screen related to fishers or specific clean-up participants.
Allows users to access a screen for data aggregation or other specific tool/functionality.
Displays the amount of plastic collected by the user in the current week (e.g., 47 kg).
Displays the user's total earnings in USDC (e.g., 24.8 USDC).
Displays the user's current balance of OCN (Ocean Coin).
Allows the user to initiate the process of logging a newly collected batch of plastic.
Allows the user to search for and connect with a "Scraper" partner (likely for verification or offloading plastic).
Directs the user to a list or dashboard of NFTs they have generated or uploaded.
Displays a list of recent collection activities, including weight and verification status.
Displays the total number of plastic collections the scraper has processed (e.g., 28 Collections).
Displays the total cumulative weight of plastic the scraper has processed/verified (e.g., 342 kg).
Displays the scraper's total earnings in USDC (e.g., 84 USDC).
Displays the total number of plastic verification requests awaiting the scraper's attention (e.g., 3 Pending Requests).
Displays information for a pending request, including the
Allows the scraper to accept a pending collection request, indicating they will verify or meet the fisher.
Allows the scraper to reject a pending collection request.
Provides a shortcut button to navigate to the
Accesses the NFT Marketplace screen via the bottom navigation bar.
Accesses the plastic data capture screen.
Accesses the Scraper Dashboard screen (current screen).
Allows the user to return to the previous screen (
Displays the visual representation or image associated with the NFT.
Displays the unique identifier and name of the collected plastic NFT (e.g., Ocean Plastic Collection #742).
Shows the primary purchase price of the NFT in USDC stablecoin (e.g., 12.5 USDC).
Shows the equivalent or alternative purchase price in the native OCN Coins (e.g., 250 OCN Coins).
Displays verifiable details about the plastic collection, including the
Allows the user to express interest or save the NFT to a personal favorites list.
Allows the user to bookmark or save the NFT for later viewing/consideration.
Initiates the transaction process to buy the NFT for the specified USDC price (e.g., Buy for 12.5 USDC).
A dedicated button to immediately navigate back to the main list of NFTs.
Allows the user to return to the previous screen (likely the "Collect Plastic" screen) without saving.
Displays the photo taken in the previous step for review.
Allows the user to manually enter the estimated weight of the collected plastic in kilograms.
Provides a text field for the user to add any extra information or notes about the collection.
Indicates that the location is enabled, suggesting the collection's GPS coordinates will be recorded upon submission.
Finalizes the data entry and sends the collection request (photo, weight, notes, location) for processing/verification.
Discards the current image and returns the user to the camera/upload screen to capture a new photo.
Allows the user to return to the previous screen (likely the Fisherman Dashboard).
Provides an area to tap and either take a new photo or upload an existing image of the collected plastic.
Allows the user to manually enter the estimated weight of the collected plastic in kilograms (e.g., 15.5 kg).
Provides a text field for the user to add an optional boat identifier (e.g., BOAT-2024-001).
Confirms that the device's GPS location has been captured for the collection (e.g., Lat: 12.34, Long: 56.78).
Finalizes the data and sends the collection request for processing/verification.
Discards the current data entry and returns the user to the previous screen.
This section covers the user journey for checking stats and logging a new plastic collection.
Dashboard loads with "Weekly Plastic", "Earnings", and "OCN Coin Balance" cards visible
On the Fisherman Dashboard, tap the "Log Plastic Collection" button.
User is redirected to the "Collect Plastic" screen with a camera interface
On the "Collect Plastic" screen, tap the "Take Photo" button.
The camera captures an image and proceeds to the "Review Capture" screen
On the "Review Capture" screen, tap the "Estimated Weight (kg)" input field.
A numeric keyboard appears, allowing the user to enter a value (e.g., 2.5)
After entering weight and notes, tap "Submit Collection".
The collection is submitted for verification, and the user returns to the dashboard or receives a success confirmation
This section covers finding a "Scraper" partner to offload collected plastic.
On the Fisherman Dashboard, tap "Find Scraper Partner".
Identify a station marked "Available" and tap "Request Partner".
The app navigates to the "Request Accepted" screen with collection details
On the "Request Accepted" screen, tap the "[Map View]" or "Start Navigation" button.
The map view opens, navigating the user to the scraper's location
On the "Request Accepted" screen, tap "Back to Dashboard".
User is returned directly to the main Fisherman Dashboard
This section covers the Scraper's role in accepting requests from fishermen.
A list of "Pending Requests" is visible, showing Fisher ID, Distance, and Weight
Locate a pending request card and tap the "Accept" button.
The request status updates (likely moves to active/verified), and the "Pending Requests" count decreases
Locate a pending request card and tap the "Decline" button.
The request is removed from the list
Check the top stats section on the Scraper Dashboard.
"Earnings" in USDC are displayed and match the user's history
This section covers browsing and interacting with the NFT marketplace.
On the Marketplace screen, tap the "Trending" tab.
The list of NFTs refreshes to show trending items
Tap on any NFT card in the list.
The "NFT Details" screen opens, displaying Metadata (Collector, Weight, Impact Score)
On the "NFT Details" screen, tap the "Save" (bookmark) button.
The purchase transaction process is initiated
